greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Tree of Eratosthenes: a(0) = 1, a(1) = 2; after which, a(2n) = A250469(a(n)), a(2n+1) = 2 * a(n).
comment: This sequence can be represented as a binary tree. Each child to the left is obtained by applying A250469 to the parent, and each child to the right is obtained by doubling the parent:
Sequence A252755 is the mirror image of the same tree. A253555(n) gives the distance of n from 1 in both trees.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..8192
Index entries for sequences that are permutations of the natural numbers
formula: As a composition of related permutations:
A055396(a(n)) = A001511(n). [A005940 has the same property.]
a(A003945(n)) = A001248(n) for n>=1. - _Peter Luschny_, Jan 13 2015
mathematica: b[1] = 1; b[n_] := If[PrimeQ[n], NextPrime[n], m1 = p1 = FactorInteger[n][[ 1, 1]]; For[k1 = 1, m1 <= n, m1 += p1; If[m1 == n, Break[]]; If[ FactorInteger[m1][[1, 1]] == p1, k1++]]; m2 = p2 = NextPrime[p1]; For[k2 = 1, True, m2 += p2, If[FactorInteger[m2][[1, 1]] == p2, k2++]; If[k1+2 == k2, Return[m2]]]];
xref: Similar permutations: A005940, A252755, A054429, A250245.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Jan 02 2015
